titleStmt.title: Neural Networks with Quadratic VC Dimension

analytic.title: Neural Networks with Quadratic VC Dimension

abstract.p: This paper shows that neural networks which use continuous activation functions have VC dimension at least as large as the square of the number of weights w. This result settles a long-standing open question, namely whether the well-known O(w log w) bound, known for hard-threshold nets, also held for more general sigmoidal nets. Implications for the number of samples needed for valid generalization are discussed.
